result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon E Pawelski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 09/25/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: $250.00 payable to Christine K.; to be paid first and foremost

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expungee if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4). Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges as ordered on Count 1

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Jon E Pawelski in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Victim Impact Statement filed and reviewed by the parties.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Restitution set in the amount of $250.00; payable to Christine K.; to be paid first and foremost.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 59 days in the House of Correction with credit for 59 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Jon E Pawelski in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jon E Pawelski not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Attorney Phillips called and informed the clerk he had a family emergency and could not appear.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court, defendant Jon E Pawelski not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jon E Pawelski in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Jon E Pawelski in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. JUDDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DALLET. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christine K.

Defendant Jon E Pawelski in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jon E Pawelski in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
